intro: Senecio bohemicus, commonly known as the Bohemian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio bohemicus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
